Pre-Game Insights: Bosnia-Herzegovina and Hungary will look to claim their first win of the 2024-25 UEFA Nations League when they face off in Zenica on Monday.
Bosnia are leading Group A3, while the visitors are one point better off in third position.
Bosnia look to be in a head-to-head battle with Hungary to avoid automatic relegation, while Netherlands and Germany are set to compete for promotion.

Bosnia may have lost eight of their last nine international, but their only draw in that period did take place in their reverse fixture against Hungary, and we think that the two nations could play out another draw in Monday's clash in Zenica.
Hungary are sitting in the relegation playoff spot after drawing two and losing one of their first three Nations League matches.
Bosnia-Herzegovina are unable to call upon Adrian Leon Barisic and Ermedin Demirovic, with the pair set to serve one-match bans for yellow card accumulation.
Hungary are unable to call upon Loic Nego, Milos Kerkez and Krisztofer Horvath after the trio pulled out of the squad due to injury.
Dominik Szoboszlai will continue to skipper his country, with the 23-year-old set to support Roland Sallai and Barnabas Varga in attack.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bosnia-Herzegovina's only draw in their recent nine international matches was against Hungary.
Hungary have won just one of their last six internationals.
The last time Hungary played away against Bosnia-Herzegovina was in Euro 2008 qualifying in September 2006, resulting in a 3-1 victory for Hungary.
